content: I've never used it, but it looks cool......i like it:) One day, i'll open it, & let the journey begin. It's wonderfull i tell ya, absolutely wonderfull!!! I like the purple, & grey colors.
I have been paid up forever. Product has always been top-notch. Cannot count it's usefulness over, well over a decade... Now aproaching perfection, IMHO. Love it.
I was happy to pay for the pro version. It works very well for me. I also bought the pro RDP product from the same developer.

Excellent app. It works well and can even let you use a VNC desktop securely over SSH, so what's not to like! I've used it with home servers and Raspberry Pi's for a few years and it's never let me down :-)
replyContent: Hi Andrew, it's on the todo list, but there are so many things to do!! :)

content: missing plus button on android 10, refunded
replyContent: Fix is out. Cheers! iordan

content: After looking for years, this is the best app for the job. I particularly like automatically starting my VNC server over SSH just by clicking my connection. That way the VNC server doesn't have to be always running. The latest update made it even better looking

Great app - UI can use some improvements and why doesn't it offer to save SSH passwords even thought I've set a master password? This is the only reason I bought the Pro version. Update: 2020 Aug 18 The new version can not open once I've set a master password. I had to clear the app data and set up my connection profiles again.

I need to know colour depth and view only settings before I connect, not what the screenshot was. I now have to long press, then press edit to get back to where I used to be upon opening the app, then Show, to get to where I need to be. For me, the new screenshot list is an added pain. However, I appreciate the continued development to my favourite VNC app :)
replyContent: Well, that is hardly something to complain about. Here is how you use the new app - you make 3 connections, and you put in the nickname what each one is for. Say you have 24bpp, rw, 24bpp, ro, and 8bpp, ro. Then, you launch the app, use the search to enter rw and you'll see the two rw connections.  Type ro and you'll see the ro connection. Cheers!

content: Perfect. Key pair creating feature is very useful. Easy to connect and no disconnection was noticed ever since its first launch.

Your vnc is the only one where the spen (note 9) actually behaves like a mouse. So I bought your app as an apprectiation. BUT please have an input mode where, for right click I have to hold. Please! With this feature it will be complete. Will you do it?
replyContent: Why don't you use Single Handed Input mode for now? I will add the feature request to the list, just can't guarantee any timelines :).

content: Would it be possible to add a "fit to width" option in the "Scaling" menu? This would make it work better with x11vnc
replyContent: Adding it to the TODO list. thanks!

content: Highly recommended. Been using for almost 4 years to remote access Linux workstations/servers. Still the best VNC app I've found, and it's given me the ability to perform meaningful remote tasks from anywhere via my phone. Easy to set up and highly configurable - I was able to quickly set up multiple connections from private and public networks using the VNC over SSH option. Supports passwords as well as RSA keys (easy to import) for better security. Once connected you get full functionality on the remote machine. The screen can be zoomed and panned, there's full mouse functionality including left/right/middle click, and the keyboard has CRTL, ESC, arrow, etc. keys. I upgraded to the pro version in recognition of the obvious amount of work that has gone into the app. Have a problem? I found the developer very responsive via the forum.

Great. But would be good if it detected high resolution monitor attached thru OTG or screen mirror like some other apps, or like videos do. So when attached to a UHD monitor, Citrix Workspace detects that and the phone app goes high resolution to fill screen. And not up-convert, actual native 3840x2160. Verified on Huawei P20. Would be great if BVNC could do that too...
Only one with reasonable s pen support but still doesn't work well
fatal
replyContent: What happened? :)

content: Looks like poop. Works well though. Look into material design guidelines, ADA AA contrast requirements and a little thing called padding.
Fantastic VLC app, feature rich and it works as supposed to. It's noticeable that you made it with dedication. Thanks.

Terrific app. I installed the free version first, to check it out. It works very, very well - even establishing VNC connections over a secure channel (SSH, in my case) to hosts behind a firewall is straightforward to do, once you know your way around the app. I decided to get the pay version, not necessarily because I want to get extra features or get rid of the marketing window, but because I think that the developer deserves it. Notice that migrating from the free one to the pay version is painless, thanks to the Import/Export Settings capability available in both versions. Very highly recommended.
Work well üëç

Blown away by this app...someone is finally producing the kind of fully configurable functionality I like to see.  VNC over ssh where you can import the private key etc etc...key functions, mouse functions that all work and zoomable desktop...I couldn't ask for anything more.  Full marks to the dev... I tried the free version and didn't hesitate to take the donate option with the pro version even though I don't think I need the extras it brings! Never has five stars been so inadequate to describe how impressed I am with a piece of software. :)

Does not have multiple monitors support (need this!). Also impossible to 
read most text on modern Samsung devices using the default/stock theme 
(black text on dark gray). Have had these issues for years.
replyContent:
About multiple monitors, please see the discussion here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/bvnc-ardp-aspice-opaque-android-bb10-clients/lf3P_XM-UCc

About the contrast issue, it was fixed a while ago. Did it not help you?

content:
Excellent app. The only one that I found that works with my BT keyboard and 
mouse. Just one problem. Since upgrading to Android 8. Connect button text 
is in black so difficult to see. Also the menu on the right for disconnect 
is flickering to left & right very fast. I can still disconnect as it is a 
horizontal flicker. Samsung Galaxy S8 plus.
replyContent: What is your device? Please get in touch on the forum at https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bvnc-ardp-aspice-opaque-android-bb10-clients. Thanks!

content: After trying several apps:this one is the best. Smart zooming,easy keyboard access. Update: why do you need newly access to media files and wifi connection information?
Good app, however it does not have a good mode for if you have a stylus. I cant figure out how to select text ether.
replyContent: Select text by double-tapping, or triple-tapping (as if clicking with the mouse on a line of text). Alternatively, long-tap, and the remote pointer will begin a mouse-drag movement. After that, without lifting your finger move it, and ti will select text. Some more info in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BDqIDD-eat8 Cheers!

content: Works great on older Android platforms. Does not work on newer platforms
replyContent: EDIT: Please get in touch to tell me what doesn't work, I may need to fix it!! Previously: What doesn't work, Curtis? It would be best if you post on the forum since discussion in reviews is difficult. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bvnc-ardp-aspice-opaque-android-bb10-clients

content: The best rdp app and developer always improving it!!!
For my purposes the best VNC client: SSH transport, mouse/touchpad works including right-click, CTRL key and other special keys work properly. Other VNC clients are always missing in some department.

Great, simple VNC client software.  Works flawlessly with Linux Mint host running default desktop sharing utility.  If you need to move away from the RealVNC product, this is an outstanding alternative.
fantastic vnc!  I use it all the time to remotely control my Linux desktop and server
This app fits perfectly my need to use VNC via SSH tunnel. Allows me to do quick remote trouble shooting of servers from my phone.

Great app. Was looking for a replacement for "VNC Viewer for Android" (last update 2011-03) and this one has pretty much all I need, and it's still under development. It would be great to have a better keyboard overlay like the one JuiceSSH has (Ctrl, Arrows, ...), but it works good the way it is.
Best remote vnc based app
Unable to work with default GNOME Vino settings as it enforces an encryption method that not supported on Android.
replyContent: Hey, yeah, sorry about that but it's Android's and the developers of Vino's fault. For now, all we can do is disable Vino's encryption and use SSH for security if necessary... I would ask Vino's developers to implement VeNCrypt, and your help on that front would be appreciated!

content: Requires a lot more configuration options: for example my remote screen shows up at the bottom (there should be an ability to center/fill/top placement of the remote screen when it has smaller resolution than the phone/tablet). Immersive mode should be optional (no need for it when the remote screen has less height than the phone/tablet screen).
replyContent: EDIT: Did you have a chance to disable immersive mode? Immersive mode is now optional, controllable via the Main Menu in the connection setup screen. Enjoy and thanks!

content: Just doesn't work. Now i cannot get a refund. Big fail. Please refund me as it is a boat anchor when it did work straight away. Maybe because i also update to day to version 6.0.1 os.
replyContent: EDIT: Did you have a chance to disable Diffie Hellman ciphers? Android 6 does not support them. The app should tell you that and show you what commands to run to disable DH ciphers with Vino and x11vnc. As an aside, this version of bVNC is mostly intended for donation purposes. If anybody wants a refund, contact me within reasonable time by email.

content: It was working ok, but now I can't connect to Ubuntu desktop sharing, can you help me
Works with all types of VNC servers I've tried.
I love this app.becauee it supports VNC over Secure SSH
works with no hassel
I really like this app for my VNC needs. Unfortunately it does not support RealVNC's encryption which I use at home and I have to leave it unencrypted. Will this come in future versions?
replyContent: I am not sure whether RealVNC will appreciate if I reverse engineer their security. To avoid complications, and because it's a proprietary protocol that can change with no notice and is difficult to reverse-engineer, I have not implemented it. Please use SSH tunnelling to secure your connection if you're connecting from a remote location.

content: I like how this VNC client just works. I've been using tigervnc's -via option a lot and this app offers the exact same functionality. It's simple, effective and fast. I also like the fact that the interface is the same as with aRDP and aSPICE. Besides, the multiple mouse modes are a must, I'm used to trackpads so I prefer trackpad mode and not many apps offer that.

Check the free version works before buying this. Used to be my go to app now stopped working after android 6 update. Crashes on pan or zoom. Frustrating since paid for app now broken. Android vnc still works though and is free.
replyContent: Hi John, Sorry to hear that. Have you been able to report the crash when it happens? That way I can see a stack-trace and try to find the bug.

content: Perfect
Brilliant piece of software. My Mac loves it :)
Every time I try to activate Android keyboard, my pc mouse pointer will be move to top left corner and clicked. (Vnc server: windows 7 + tightvnc)
replyContent: EDIT: If this is still relevant, can you please get in touch via the support forum? Thanks!

content: Excellent, this is the best app. Great great great job, hats off to the developers.Thank you.

Thankfully I refunded in time... Ui is the worst I've ever seen... Mouse position was way off and bugged.... Looks like good secure VNC with great UI is a pipe dream.. Someone should make an app cause there's a massive hole in this market
replyContent: Hey Ashton, thanks so much for raging against my app after refunding it. There is a free version for you to try free of charge any time It's one of the top results when you search for VNC. There is also a support forum where you can get help. You can try again some other time when you're less angry.

content: Used to connect to my Linode server running TigerVNC. Excellent performance, butter-smooth on fast connections even with my 2012 Nexus 7. I do have one suggestion, though: Allow the user to control the level of JPEG compression when using Tight encoding, so that the user can set the right trade-off between quality and bandwidth requirements. The heavy-handed JPEG compression isn't exactly necessary or ideal when on a fast Wi-Fi connection, and I'd rather not fall back on the inefficient Hextile encoding.
replyContent: Fair.

content: bVNC is a great app. I use it with tightVNC on my home server running win7 x64.  I only wish file transfer was supported, please implement for the ultimate, remote PC management tool.
Now I can develop and support directly from my phone.
Cool software
I use this on my phone regularly, but on a tablet with a Bluetooth keyboard it's every bit as good as sitting in front of the machine's graphical console. Nice work!
replyContent: Thanks, Ben! :)

content: 2.99 is a tremendous value, paying monthly fees for access to your computers is silly when you can use this great utility, I use it for my business quickly drop in on employees and making sure they are doing what they are supposed to be doing on the computer, complete transparency. Easy to set up, easy to use, hats off to the the developer for making such an affordable and feature laden application.

Does everything I need from a VNC viewer and I really like the input method options. Very responsive app at various connection speeds. The developer is also friendly and timely when responding to emails. Well worth supporting this app.

I use this app to administer several FreeBSD and Linux VPSes behind a public IP address. The VPSes are managed by Qemu/KVM and VNC listens on a private IP/Port pairing. bVNC navigates this scenario well.

Well made very useful software with base functionality released as open source. The only one with working peripherals support and still comfortable for touch screen. I can only complain about the numpad not working and smaller screens not being centered.
replyContent: In Fit-To-Screen mode it should center the screen. Numpad not working is a very strange one. What does it do? Join the forum here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bvnc-ardp-aspice-opaque-android-bb10-clients

content: Great app!  The only thing I could ask for would be a feature request to support resizing the geometry of the window.  I've come to enjoy tigervnc's ability to adjust to changes in window sizing and entering full screen by dynamically adjusting the resolution.  I think that would be a great feature so that if I connect from my tablet, I would get native resolution (1080p).  And when I connect from my phone I would also get native resolution (UHD / 4k)...
replyContent: Join the forum here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/bvnc-ardp-aspice-opaque-android-bb10-clients

content: This is the only VNC client that won't cripple a Bluetooth keyboard's arrow, other motion, function, and Ctrl & Alt keys.   Ditto for "Hacker's Keyboard". [Every other VNC client will mess up those keyboards.] It also has decent latency over the network.  Well worth donating for.

I've went through at least 5 apps before sticking with bVNC. Others don't have as much features or is reliable and clean as this one. What I like most is that it has many input modes and auto fit to screen. Controls are non intrusive and can be hidden making it useful for view-only applications. Furthermore, settings are persistent and can be exported and shared. For best performance, use it with tightvnc and the DFMirage driver when having the vnc server on windows. (RealVNC on win 8 was very unreliable)

bVNC does everything I need a VNC app to do, and it does it better than the alternatives... for free. The Pro version doesn't add anything I rely on, but for its modest price, it's well worth the satisfaction of doing a little bit to support the development of this free and open-source project.
Bvnc contains all of the security features you need.
Please bring this app to the F-Droid repository. Google Play sucks and is not a good distribution platform for Free Software.

I am using this VNC version since it seems to work the best connecting to ESXi VM's.   I am trying to launch a specific connection form the command line or an activity starter in app inventor. I got to here but am having trouble passing the extras for the address & port:     am start -a android.intent.action.VIEW -d vnc: -n com.iiorda nov.bVNC/.RemoteCanvasActivity -f 0x10000000
I have been using this app for about 9 months now and with the hackers keyboard for standard keyboard commands i can control my broadcast automation system from anywhere.

This is by far the best VNC client I've used for Android, which I use for accessing my local DebianKit chroot. The simple full featured + paid model is awesome and I wish it was more common. One feature that would make it even better would be to support AutoX locally (eg by supporting local custom commands for starting X + vnc to account for all the different chroot things). Ill probably implement this using seperate scripts for now.
replyContent: Hey Joe, if I may be of some help, I've enforced policy (for example asking for UNIX credentials) server-side by wrapping the real x11vnc binary in a script that lives in /usr/local/bin and moving the real binary to something like x11vnc.real. The wrapper script obviously exec's x11vnc.real with the special options I want added. Hope this helps!

content: This is as good as it gets on a phone! I use it to connect to my Macbook Pro through an SSH connection. I can manage my Mac from any decent internet connection. It does an awesome job of handling my Retina screen on a Galaxy S4. That's no small feat given the screen and input differences between a smart phone and a laptop.

This is the best out of the many free viewers I have tried. It has everything necessary and it controls very fluidly. I've had only a handful of crashes in many months of use so it is very reliable. The dev was great at responding and fixing the issue when I noticed my jump from an S3 to Note 4 changed the back button to an Escape key.
Simply great!
I am using it often to connect to several Linux machines, both directly and through SSH. Never had a problem. The various input options are handy and well designed.

My setup is that I VNC from a pad to a headless Linux for day to day work. VNC is where I live. It's freedom and I need it to breath. I have all the VNC apps, paid versions, and I give them all a try every six months or so to see who works best for me. What I require at a bare minimum are working ctrl, alt, shift and esc with hacker's keyboard, click on touch, easy right click, easy drag select, one-to-one scale, managable memory requirements and a decent response lag. No on screen keys is good. This app has it all and more! The key enabled SSH tunnel feature is superb! This new kid on the block rules them all! Feature request: please add a reconnect option inside the menu, and maybe clean it up a bit. I never use any of the options, other than disconnect (so I can reconnect again -due to many weak-wifi-related freezes). If you would be able, one day, to detect freezes and issue the reconnect automatically then you would truely write your name into history! And another feature request: could you remember keyboard state (open vs. closed) across disconnects (I tend to use the pad "keyboard" much more than its "mouse"). At the far horizon, if I was in your field, I would work on ipv6.
I've tried a bunch, and this one has met and exceeded my needs and expectations. Used the free version for a few months and just paid for the pro to support. Keep up the good work.

Great vnc client, nice with public key ssh tunnel support. Though, would really benefit from true fullscreen support (hide action bar) and options to turn off the overlay keyboard icons (e.g., when you use a physical keyboard)
Only complaint is excessive notifications during initial connect to remote computer.  Otherwise a nice app.
replyContent: Hi Howard, you're right, I have to think of something more intelligent.

content: A fast and responsive little VNC client. Great usability. Screen zoom in/out works very nicely and does not steal focus or hide the keyboard. The quick-access keys (popup keys for tab, esc, shift, ctrl, super, alt + arrows) are a superb idea and well implemented. I hate having to bring the Android keyboard up or go into the menu, so this feature is highly appreciated. But I sorely need quick access to pgup, pgdn, home, end, ins, delete/bkspc etc. (and maybe even F keys) - it would be nice if users could configure which quick-access keys poped up (bit of work for the developer, though). The send-keys and send-text functions are also great and can be used for this, but you have to go into the menu. I used the free version for a week and then upgraded to pro because I think this app is worth supporting. Very happy and would like to see new features added (hint: more quick-access keys). Thanks for this tight little piece of software.

The only problem is it should not insist to store the ssh key passphrase, since it makes it totally insecure if someone gains access to your device.  Please allow the passphrase to be blank and prompt for it at connection-time, without storing it, if so.
replyContent: Hey Andy, it doesn't store the ssh password or passphrase! If you quit the application (Back from connection screen or killed from running apps), the ssh-related pwds are blanked. I don't blank it on connect/disconnect for convenience (in case you lose connectivity and want to quickly reconnect).

content: Use the free app for months and it never fails. Worth the donation to this dev. Couple this with Hackers Keyboard in transparent theme and you can easily remote control your PCs
So simple to use, well worth the money.
This software rocks! Awesome VNC over ssh. It's working great with Ubuntu 14.04.
Only minor thing is keyboard overlay icon popping up when clicking with mouse. Would be nice to be able to disable it especially when using external bluetooth keyboard.
replyContent: The keyboard icon popping up when clicking with the mouse was a much requested feature because of the use-case where one clicks in a text box and then needs the keyboard to type something in right away. Thanks!

content: Easy configuration for vnc over ssh, with good performance and lots of configuration options where it counts. Works seamlessly with RealVNC. Full marks from me.
After trying a few VNC clients this one has everything I was looking for and more.  Highly recommended and thanks to the dev for the fantastic work!
Works on all my devices and can even set up a secure session whether or not vnc is running on my host linux machine or not. I love this app!
Excellent
Thank you so much for adding bluetooth mouse support with direct pass through of right and middle click.  Now I am able to use your app to work in remote programs too complex for a touch interface.
Well developed, fast and stable!
Love this app so much I bought the pro version. Then updates came and now  my back button right click hasn't worked for a month. Please fix it to the way it used to be.
replyContent: Edit: Please email me if you want this resolved. Due to popular demand, the back button on external keyboards was remapped to Esc. Back buttons that are on-device *should* send right-click instead. If an on-device back button is sending Esc rather than right-clicking, please send me an email through Google Play if you'd like to help me debug it.

content: This app works great on a first generation Nexus 7. I am deeply impressed. They keyboard is even better than the one used in ConnectBot.
thanks Iordan, that's great work.
replyContent: Edit: Thanks! :)

content: Excellent app! I use it to connect remotely to my work desktop which runs Ubuntu 12.04.  If running Ubuntu make sure that you are not using proprietary graphics drivers as these can create some display problems.
replyContent: This may be because of Unity. I've noticed that only Unity 2D works properly with vino, the built-in server. Was this the issue?

content: Good but deletion of icon in home screen is annoying when update
replyContent: Hi Shengqiang, I had no idea this happens, thanks!

content: Program feels very well implemented, constant updates, runs like a dream. Awesome!
Perfect.
I've used the free version for years, every day... Until right now. Thank you UNDATECH for the top notch apps.  Better than RealVNC viewer. (Ouch!) DONATE DONATE DONATE DONATE.
replyContent: Thanks for your kind words, Dana! I appreciate your and everybody else's support! iordan

content: This is the only Android VNC that allows me to use my dock touchpad correctly (TF700t). The dev is fantastic and extremely helpful!
I don't need any of the pro functions but want to support the developer because the app works so well.
Thanks for the excellent free software.
Faster than any other vnc, highly developed. Simply the best among them, tablet mode, two finger drag to scroll.

I found this app to be the best VNC client for my uses on a tablet and phone.   I connect to Linux and Windows 8 systems with desktops larger than 1600x1200.  The speed of the screen refreshes and smoothness of mouse movements along with ease of use compared to other clients I have tried convinced me to donate with the Pro version.  Very nice app.  Thank you.  My only issue so far is I could not successfully send a Windows print screen hot-key sequence and been able to get a local screen capture of the desktop.  I have not yet attempted to contact the author but that's where I'm headed now...  Edit: I'm trying to do a Alt-Shift-PrintScreen through the VNC connection.  I would like to edit the screen shot using an editor on the workstation I'm connected to and I would like to capture the full graphical detail from the workstation perspective and not from my VNC view (as I would get doing a screenshot from my tablet).  When I go to paste the screenshot that should be in the clipboard there is nothing there to paste. Its something I do on a regular basis from a workstation.  No biggy though.  I use the Win8 SnippingTool when connected from my tablet to get the screenshot.
replyContent: v3.4.8 should have sending the Windows combination for screen capture fixed (through the Send Keys dialog). Thanks for the report!

content: Best SSH&VNC app for android that I've found. Very configurable.
brilliant app. does what it should.
Best vncviewer for droid
Running cyanogenmod kitkat 4.4 Using vnc over ssh with private key.
A fter trying the trial version l decided to donate .I hope that the developer will consider supporting stylus input more specifically .

I really like this app. I used the free version for several days and  now upgraded to the "donate"  version! Thank you for your work! One thing: it would be great to have a possibility to export the vpn settings from the free version and import them in the pro version :-)
replyContent: Please scroll down to the bottom of the main screen and use the "Import/Export Settings" button to export and then import your settings :).

content: This is an excellent VNC client. And it's great that we can support an open source project by donating.
Really brilliant VNC app - and autoX set to find only works perfectly to avoid an always running vnc server.

The only VNC app that actually worked flawless with bluetooth keyboard. Also the only one where the mouse is exactly where you put the pointer and is not laggy. I used this extensively for hours connecting to my windows machine and my Raspberry pi. I showed my gratitude by donating to a great app. My wishlish: Add a gesture where your mouse pointer can come to where you click when using virtual mousepad. The mouse@ is pretty useless. Perhaps an inward spiral motion? One again. Thank you
replyContent: Have you noticed that the mouse-pointer goes to where you zoom? I.e. in touchpad mode, I never let the mouse pointer stay off-screen, because a subsequent motion of the pointer would make the screen suddenly jump to where the pointer is. Hence, zooming in makes the pointer show up in the middle of the screen the moment it is about to go off-screen.

content: Vnc is challenging on the small screen but this program delivers in spite of the challenges.  I imagine this program works even better on a tablet.

Was using AndroidVNC with ConnectBot. bVNC replaces both and is much more functional than AndroidVNC.  I love the intuitive controls and the ability to make key pairs and automatically tunnel. Great app with lots of control!
replyContent: Have you tried setting up AutoX yet?

content: Useful desktop control from phone
The latest update fixed the right click on the ASUS TF700T hardware keyboard.  This is a great app by a fantastic developer.

This app has developed from good to great.  Go pro, its cheap as chips and will continue to support nice development.  Good image quality, single hand input rocks, very intuitive, now my old boxes can go headless in a wardrobe, and I can iTunes, or photoshop from my phone or tablet with little fuss.  Thanks

I'm using it primarily to connect to a remote server running the CentOS Linux distribution. It works great when the Asus TF101 tablet has the keyboard attached with the integrated mouse pad.  However when I use the tablet without attached keyboard dock "clicking" with finger doesn't work.   However, If I logon to my Window 7 box when Asus keypad isn't connected the"clicking" with finger works.  Is there something I need to change to get it to work without keyboard on the Linux box.  Would give it a 5 if I could use without the keypad
replyContent: Edit: Hi Bob, has anything changed with the latest version of bVNC? There have been numerous improvements since your post.

content: Well designed transparent local keyboard overlay.  Great SSH integration: the app lets you generate new a SSH key set, or import your existing key.  I've used this app to connect via SSH tunnel to UltraVNC servers on Windows, and other Android devices using the SSH server app "SSHDroidPro" by Berserker, and the VNC server "droid VNC server" app by Jos√© Pereira.  You can export all your VNC connection settings, then import them into bVNC Pro running on another device (great for when you upgrade your phone).
Using on S4 and Tab 2.0, works great with Ultra VNC. Multiple monitors show up very well in this app.
Connects but only shows login canvas even though I am logged on. Keystrokes are not working to enter password (osx 10.7.5). Interface does not provide a username for the mac screen sharing.
replyContent: EDIT: Hi Antonius. bVNC now supports Mac OS X logins with user name and password.

content: With an external bluetooth keyboard, Debian Kit w/lxde my Nexus 7 is now have a very powerful very portable computer environment

To be honest, the free bVNC app works great, I rely on it for my work.  There are times where I have to use my tablets to get into my workstation, and bVNC is hands down the best VNC, especially on the Transformer Prime and Kindle Fire (installed through Aptoide)  This is the one to use, feature rich, and doesn't get in your way.  The app works WITH you not AGAINST you.  I can work all day through VNC with this app, and it doesn't kill my battery.  Just an all around great app, can't say enough good things about it.  Well done dev, you get my monies ;)
Thanks dev
Log into openvpn and light this up. need to right Ctrl to escape your VM.... its there. Need to change desktops... it works. This is the first time I have considered VNC a mobile alternative to SSH!

I have been a long time user of the free-as-in-beer version of this program, and it really solves the various problems related to controlling a desktop machine from a tablet better than any of the other VNC clients I've tried. I'm not terribly pleased with the fact that the author has added ads to the free-as-in-beer version, but since it's still free-as-in-free (GPL), I've decided to reward the donation-based approach to funding the project rather than the ad-based approach.
Works flawlessly and intuitively with ultravnc, secure plugin and all. Free version has all features - bought paid version to support the developer.
Worth the money to help support this developers great work.
Of the various VNC clients on android that I have tried, and I've tried quite a few, this is the best.  Very good, eminently usable.
This "just works" -- something we really need for vnc over ssh.  The options for remote mouse support are the best.  Support this effort by buying the paid version.
Amazing. Pay for it so the dev can continue to support it and add features.
This is the only one that let me control  a linux desktop without an external mouse (I have one but don't need or miss it) and without bugs about the keyboard.
Running ubuntu on rooted Transformer with dock, really close to laptop experience with this app! The extra gestures for middle click and even scroll event are handy.
Works Great

The multitouch/gesture freatures are extremly nicely done,  and very useful. The best mouse control among VNC clients on Android I have seen (many).  Linux friendly -  3rd mouse button press is emulated by 3finger tap.  Overall, the best VNC client  on Android !  N.B .: To use the keyboard cursor keys in the usual manner -- do not forget to check the option "Use D-pad for arrows .." in the connection setup screen.  Being  open source, with free version separately accesible and fully functional for single connection.  Includes SSH, AutoX., and very responsive developer.  Just perfect!
..bought to support quality developer who provides fully featured free version

This is a great VNC app. The fact that it has NX-like support, called AutoX, pushes it way over the top. I've been searching for NX support for months. It's fantastic on my Transformer Prime - it looks and acts as if I'm running native KDE sessions. The developer of this app is extremely helpful and responsive. He helped me remotely investigate AutoX errors and solve them within a matter of days. I would recommend this app to anyone.
Fantastic VNC client. Greatest thing for me is the ability to do SSH tunneling with key authentication.
And file transferring and this would be the greatest vnc viewer made.
5-star application!

Controlling a computer which expects Left, Right, Middle buttons, scroll wheel and keyboard present is usually a pain on a touch device, but bVNC does an excellent job of providing controls that fit: Just touch with two fingers to do a right click (or 3 for middle). Do a long-press for drag-and-drop. Fluid zoom (which snaps at 100%) and a plethora of connection options, most notably TightVNC/JPEG compression, both over secured and unsecured lines, make for a very pleasant experience even if you're just on an EDGE connection. The developer also responds quickly, so I really have no reason not to recommend this.
Bought for the Vencrypt support alone.  Works great with TigerVNC.
Really fast plus the benefit of secure connection methods.  Just what you want

Wow, this is awesome. Works v well on Asus Transformer Prime TF201 to connect to a linux host running x11vnc (all I've tried so far). If you appreciate Hacker's Keyboard on android, and know a bit about ssh and vnc, you're in for a treat with this. Thanks!  Well worth my contribution.
Bought this version to support the developer.
